examples.ex: I'd love to go to America.

div.title: go
div.eng-def: to move or travel somewhere in order to do something

div.title: go
div.eng-def: to disappear or no longer exist

examples.ex: When I turned round the man had gone.

div.title: go badly/well, etc
div.eng-def: to develop in a particular way

div.title: go
div.eng-def: to continue to be in a particular state

examples.ex: We won't let anyone go hungry.
Did you manage to get the car going?

div.title: go
div.tr-def: düzgün çalýþmamak, arýza yapmak, iyi gitmemek

examples.ex: Her hearing is going, so speak loudly.

div.title: go
div.eng-def: If two things go, they match each other.

div.title: go
div.eng-def: to have a particular tune or words
div.tr-def: (þarký) belli bir melodisi/ezgisi ve güftesi olmak

examples.ex: I can't remember how it goes.

div.title: go
div.eng-def: to make a particular sound or movement
div.tr-def: belli bir ses çýkarmak veya hareket yapmak

examples.ex: My dog goes like this when he wants some food.
I had a go at catching a fish.
If you think you might like skiing, why don't you give it a go (= try to do it)?
Throw the dice Jane, it's your go.

div.title: have a go at sb
div.tr-def: kýzgýnca eleþtirmek, laf etmek, tenkit etmek

examples.ex: My mother's always having a go at me about my hair.

div.title: make a go of sth
div.eng-def: to try to make something succeed, usually by working hard

examples.ex: They're determined to make a go of their business.
